Job Title: Plant Controller

Location: Tamarac, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
The Plant Controller will report to the VP Finance , with a dotted line to the EVP Manufacturing . They will have a leadership role in proactively partnering with the management team to support the Manufacturing team as well as supporting the corporate finance and accounting teams . The Corporate Shared Services office will book all standard close entries, the Plant Controller will be tasked with understanding the close process and providing oversight to make sure all financials are properly recorded and make sound business and financial sense . This person will also be a key player on the management team providing key analysis and insights to guide decision making as well as taking a leadership role to improve financial performance. The Plant Controller will be tasked with budgeting and forecasting financials, as well as assisting in generating, validating, and understanding KPI’s as part of the Manufacturing management team

Responsibilities

 Provides accurate and timely operational performance reporting to meet the needs of the company leadership team including monthly and quarterly plant performance commentaries.  Provides financial advice and assistance to the management team to ensure decision making is made on a sound financial and operational basis.  Conduct monthly business review with upper management, participate in monthly S&OP and other operational meetings.  Uses data analysis techniques to identify and make recommendations to improve performance and lower unit costs.  Instills strong cost control/ reporting and planning discipline to assist senior management in controlling manufacturing costs while improving customer service and quality.  Provides leadership and direction to the shared service accounting team to ensure the financial accounting and reporting needs of the plants are met to enable the management team to meet financial goals and objectives .  Responsible for understanding critical financial reports such as profit and loss statements , KPI’s, and balance sheets .  Shared responsibility for the accuracy and timeliness of the month-end close process.  Present financial reporting and potential risk areas to senior management.  Analyze and explain unusual variance trends.  Works with management structure to raise their financial awareness and acumen.  Assists management team with short to long term capital planning including identifying and evaluating financial payback on all new capital expenditure proposals.  Conducts post implementation capital project reviews to ensure projects achieve financial objectives .  Responsible for the budgeting and forecasting f uture results .  Assist the external audits for year-end financial statements and taxes as needed .  Ensures strict compliance to all company policies procedures and controls.  Key focus areas include materials cost management labor cost and overhead expenditure control.  Additional duties needed to help drive to our Vision, fulfill our Mission, and abide by our Organization’s Values. 

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in accounting , or commensurate experience .  5 - 10 years' experience as a controller in a large sized manufacturing environment is required.  Required mastery of manufacturing and operational accounting .  Large ERP experience required . SAP experience preferred.  CPA or CMA Preferred . 

Sonny's Enterprises is the world's largest manufacturer of conveyorized car wash equipment, parts, and supplies. We are the industry leader, recognized and awarded by the International Car Wash Association for innovating new technologies to advance the industry with products proudly designed and built in the USA. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We embrace change and the opportunity it produces to maximize the potential of our most valuable resource — our PEOPLE! We invite you to explore our opportunities and grow your career with us.

We offer 100% employer paid medical plan. Other optional benefit programs are available to our employees and their families which include: 401(k) match, additional medical plans, dental, vision, flex spending account, short-term and long-term disability & life insurance coverage.

EEO Statement

Equal Opportunity Employer

Sonny’s is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.
